column4: hem in fact ubuntu doesn't install a full gnome desktop isn't it ?
sudo apasswd root
or sudo -s
to have a root consol
in synaptic, what means the orange circle of people near some packages ?
it means it's an Ubuntu supported package
ok
why isn't the gnome package not supproted by ubuntu ???
it's just a meta-package
it contains no files, and just drags various other packages in via dependencies
can I install it ?
the supported set of GNOME packages are already depended on by ubuntu-desktop
if you like.
If I try to install gnome, it ask to remove ubuntu-desktop , is it ok to do that ?
sure, but it means when you upgrade to hoary later it won't automatically install any new packages
I am already in hoary
why can't gnome and ubuntu-desktop coexists ?
gnome probably depends on totem-xine
suid = setuid ... running the binary makes you "become" the user that owns it
so if an application is suid , you are considered as root using it or is there something else ?
pretty much, yes ... assuming is setuid root
so I want to use shfsmount as a user, so I setted it as suid whith dpkg-reconfigure, that's ok ?
it's ok, provided that binary doesn't have any security holes, yes
